title: Please help recognise this font
content:
Hi, please help with this font. My first thought was simple "Times new roman", but it is'nt. Thank you for help

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Ristatyba Typofilui.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822160416/http:/typophile.com/files/Ristatyba%20Typofilui.jpg) | 150.05 KB |
author: siuvinejimas

comments.content: Looks like Adobe Garamond to me.
T.y. Jan, but Adobe Garamond's upper-case letter "A" is different :( maybe some other oppinions?

In terms of letterforms, [Trajan](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822160416/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/trajan_pro_bold) seems like a good match to me. The contrast is not quite right, but the quality of your sample isn’t too good either.

To me it looks like a combination of two different fonts. Check out the width difference of the "I" and the "S" and "A". I second Jan, looks like Garamond family, but combined with other type of font. I hope you find this approach useful!

Here is how I think the type in the sample was created: Trajan Bold + Faux Bold effect in Photoshop. Look at this comparison of the original sample (top half) to Trajan artificially emboldened (bottom half):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822160416im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ristatyba_5077.png)
Thank you Jan, mat180 and R. for oyour responces, now I can "re-invent" this font :)
